sect1.title: Darkroom
sect1.bridgehead: pen pressure control for brush masks
sect1.para: Controls how the pressure reading of a graphics tablet impacts newly generated brush strokes (see ). You can control the brush width, its hardness and its opacity. Absolute control means that the pressure reading directly defines the attribute with a value between 0% and 100%. Relative means that the pressure reading adjusts the attribute between zero and the pre-defined default value (default off).
Sets the level for smoothing of brush strokes. Stronger smoothing leads to less nodes and easier editing at the expense of lower accuracy.
Controls how individual color channels are displayed when activated in the parametric masks feature. You can choose between false color and grey scale (default false color).
sect1.bridgehead: pattern for the image infos line
sect1.para: Defines pattern for the image infos line in darkroom. See for available values.
sect1.bridgehead: position of the image info line
sect1.para: Controls in which panel we display the image info line. You can choose between top left top right top center bottom and hidden (default bottom).
Controls how to determine which modules are shown at the same time in the right panel. You can choose between groups icons search entry both (default both). (need a restart)
sect1.bridgehead: expand a single darkroom module at a time
sect1.para: Controls how darkroom modules are expanded. If this option is enabled, expanding a module by clicking collapses any currently expanded module. If you want to expand a module without collapsing the others you do so with Shift+click. Disabling this option reverts the meaning of click and Shift+click (default on).
sect1.bridgehead: expand the module when it is activated, and collapse it when disabled
sect1.para: This option allows to expand or collapse automatically modules when they are enabled or disabled. (default off)
sect1.bridgehead: scroll to darkroom modules when expanded/collapsed
sect1.para: With this option enabled the darkroom side panel will scroll a module to the top when it is expanded or collapsed (default on).
sect1.bridgehead: border around image in darkroom mode
sect1.para: Process the image in darkroom mode with a small border of the given number of pixels (default 20).
Defines whether scrollbars should be display in central view.
sect1.bridgehead: demosaicing for zoomed out darkroom mode
sect1.para: Interpolation when not viewing 1:1 in darkroom mode: always bilinear (fast) is fastest, but not as sharp. at most ppg (reasonable) is using ppg + interpolation modes specified below, full (possibly slow) will use exactly the settings for full-size export (default at most ppg (reasonable)).
Decrease to speed up preview rendering, may hinder accurate masking.
